title: Victoria Beckham dons a chic white blouse and midi-skirt as she steps out in New York
text:
She recently revealed she feels so much more confident now than she did as a young girl.

And Victoria Beckham certainly commanded attention as she exited the swanky Mark Hotel in New York on Friday.

The fashion designer, 45, showcased her sartorial prowess in a monochrome blouse which she teamed with a form-fitting white midi-skirt.

Victoria looked incredible in her chic white blouse which featured vertical and horizontal black line detailing.

The Spice Girl put emphasis on her tiny waist with a fitted white skirt which flared out over her legs.

Her skirt, which featured a sleek black design on the lower half, perfectly complemented her chic ruched nude-coloured peep-toe heels.

The beauty recently appeared on This Morning in a pre-recorded segment, where she revealed she feels more confident in herself and spoke about how she used to have 'little paranoias' when she was younger.

Victoria said: '[I] definitely feel more confident now. Definitely. There were things that I used to, little paranoias that I used to have when I was younger about myself that I just don’t care so much about now that I’m older.

'You know, I think it’s about focusing on the good bits and just being kind to yourself, you know. I mean, I think everybody should be kind to themselves and kind to each other.'

On Tuesday, Victoria was quizzed by Hoda Kotb on the Today show about the 'secret sauce' that has kept her romance with husband David, 44, working for so long.

Victoria revealed: 'The kids are our priority, everything we do revolves around the children. We both work really hard, we love what we do professionally'

She added: 'We support each other, we're very lucky to have found each other and lucky that we're growing together'

Admitting they always put their four children first, she said: 'The kids are our priority, everything we do revolves around the children. We both work really hard, we love what we do professionally.

'We support each other, we're very lucky to have found each other and lucky that we're growing together.'

The pair tied the knot in July 1999 and have children Brooklyn, 20, Romeo, 17, Cruz, 14, and Harper, eight, together.
